name: D. Equalize Them All
statement:
You are given an array a consisting of n integers. You can perform the
following operations arbitrary number of times (possibly, zero): Choose
a pair of indices (i, j) such that |i-j|=1 (indices i and j are
adjacent) and set a_i := a_i + |a_i - a_j|; Choose a pair of indices (i,
j) such that |i-j|=1 (indices i and j are adjacent) and set a_i := a_i -
|a_i - a_j|. The value |x| means the absolute value of x. For example,
|4| = 4, |-3| = 3.Your task is to find the minimum number of operations
required to obtain the array of equal elements and print the order of
operations to do it...
